p: Before you learn how to program, you should become familiar with Reeborg's world and its surroundings.
This text appears in the Contents window; you can resize it, move it, minimize it or close it. If you do close it, you can always reopen it by clicking on the Contents button at the very top.
Make this window smaller and move it downwards and to the right.

The panel on the right is the Editor panel, where you will write the programs that Reeborg will execute. It will do so in the first panel, known as the World panel. A third panel, Reeborg's Diary can also be opened from a button on the top.
Try opening and closing the various panels or resize them just to get a feel of how you can rearrange the environment.

Personally, I find it very convenient to make the position this Contents window such that its title bar is just below the main title bar and located above Reeborg's world (which should be its starting position), and use the minimize "button" ( "-" on the title bar) to hide the content when I try running some programs, clicking on it again to maximize it when I want to read the lessons.

Once you're satisfied with your exploration, click on the Next button, either near the top or bottom of this Contents window, to go to the next lesson, where you will have Reeborg take its first step.
